intro: Tornelia dissecta, commonly known as the dissected tornelia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are deeply lobed and often have a silvery underside. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Tornelia dissecta is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils.
